Our common stock is traded on Nasdaq under the symbol “GAIN.” The
following table reflects, by quarter, the high and low intraday
salesprices per share of our common stock on the Nasdaq, the
intraday sales prices as a percentage of NAV per share and
quarterly distributions declared per common share for each fiscal
quarter during the last two fiscal years. Amounts presented for
eachfiscal quarter of 2018 and 2017 represent the cumulative amount
of the distributions declared per common share for the months
composing such quarter.</p>

<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(A)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">NAV per share is determined as of the
last day in the relevant quarter and therefore may not reflect the
NAV per share on the date of the high and low intraday salesprices.
The NAVs per share shown are based on outstanding shares at the end
of each period.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(B)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">The premiums (discounts) set forth in
these columns represent the high or low, as applicable, intraday
sale prices per share for the relevant quarter minus the NAVper
share as of the end of such quarter, and therefore may not reflect
the premium (discount) to NAV per share on the date of the high and
low intraday sales prices.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(C)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Includes a $0.06 per common share
supplemental distribution in each of June and December 2017.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
As of May&nbsp;14, 2018, there were 22 record owners of our common
stock. This number does not include stockholders for whom shares
are held in “streetname.”</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Distributions</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
We generally intend todistribute, in the form of cash
distributions, up to 100% of our Investment Company Taxable Income,
if any, to our stockholders in the form of monthly distributions.
We may retain some or all of our net realized long-term capital
gains, if any, ordesignate them as a deemed distribution to
supplement our equity capital and support the growth of our
portfolio, but we generally intend to distribute all or a
substantial portion of such gains to stockholders in cash.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The Credit Facility also generally seeks to restrict distributions
on our common stock to the sum of certain amounts, including, but
not limited to, our netinvestment income, plus net capital gains,
plus amounts elected by the Company to be considered as having been
paid during the prior fiscal year in accordance with
Section&nbsp;855(a) of the Code.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Recent Sales of Unregistered Securities</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
We did not sellany unregistered shares of stock during the fiscal
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Purchases of Equity Securities</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
We did not repurchase any of our shares of stock during the fourth
quarter ended March&nbsp;31, 2018.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">39</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Stock Performance Graph</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The following graph shows the total stockholder return on an
investment of $100 in cash on March&nbsp;31, 2013 for (i)&nbsp;our
common stock, (ii)&nbsp;theNasdaq’s 100 Total Return index (“Nasdaq
100 TR”), (iii) the Russell 1000 Total Return index (“Russell 1000
TR”) and (iv)&nbsp;the Wells Fargo BDC Total Return index (“WF BDC
TR”). This year we have replaced ourpeer group of four companies
included in our 2017 annual report with the WF BDC TR. By utilizing
the WF BDC TR, which includes over 40 BDCs, we are able to include
a larger representation of the BDC landscape. The WF BDC TR
includes BDCs that arelisted on the Nasdaq or the New York Stock
Exchange and have a market capitalization greater than
$100&nbsp;million on the evaluation date. We believe the WF BDC TR
is a more appropriate comparative market index because, among other
reasons, itbetter reflects the price volatility that BDCs
experience.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
However, the following stock performance graph compares our
cumulative total return with thatof both the newly selected indices
and the indices used in our 2017 annual report. The returns on each
investment assume reinvestment of dividends. This stock
performance&nbsp;graph&nbsp;and the related textual information are
not necessarilyindicative of future performance.</p>
<p STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">

<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><a NAME="tx588089_8" ID="tx588089_8"></a>ITEM&nbsp;6. SELECTED
FINANCIAL DATA</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The following consolidated selected financial data as of and for
the fiscal years ended March&nbsp;31, 2018, 2017, 2016, 2015, and
2014, are derived from ouraccompanying audited <i>Consolidated
Financial Statements</i>. The other data included in the second
table below is unaudited. The data should be read in conjunction
with our audited accompanying <i>Consolidated Financial
Statements</i> and notesthereto and “<i>Management’s Discussion and
Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations</i>”
included elsewhere in this Annual Report.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center"><b>GLADSTONE INVESTMENT CORPORATION</b></p>

"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center"><b>CONSOLIDATED SELECTED FINANCIAL AND OTHER
DATA</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center"><b>(DOLLAR AMOUNTS IN THOUSANDS, EXCEPT PER SHARE
DATA)</b></p>

"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(A)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Weighted average yield on
investments, excluding loans on <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-accrual</font> status, equals interest
income earned on investmentsdivided by the weighted average
interest-bearing principal balance throughout the fiscal year.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(B)</sup>&nbsp;</td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Weighted average yield on
investments, including loans on <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-accrual</font> status, equals interest
income earned on investments divided by the weighted average total
principal balancethroughout the fiscal year.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(C)</sup>&nbsp;</td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Total return equals the change in the
ending market value of our common stock from the beginning of the
fiscal year, taking into account common dividends reinvested in
accordance with the terms of the dividendreinvestment plan. Total
return does not take into account common distributions that may be
characterized as a return of capital. For further information on
the estimated character of our distributions to common
stockholders, refer to Note 9 —<i>Distributions to Common
Stockholders</i> in the accompanying <i>Notes to Consolidated
Financial Statements</i> included elsewhere in this Annual
Report.</td>

ALIGN="center">42</p>

<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><a NAME="tx588089_9" ID="tx588089_9"></a>ITEM&nbsp;7. MANAGEMENT’
S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION ANDRESULTS OF
OPERATIONS</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>The following analysis of our financial condition and results of
operations should be read in conjunction with ouraccompanying</b>
<b><i>Consolidated Financial Statements</i></b> <b>and the notes
thereto contained elsewhere in this Annual Report. Historical
financial condition and results of operations and percentage
relationships among any amounts in thefinancial statements are not
necessarily indicative of financial condition, results of
operations or percentage relationships for any future periods.
Except per share amounts, dollar amounts in the tables included
herein are in thousands unlessotherwise indicated.</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>OVERVIEW</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><u>General</u></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
We were incorporated under the General Corporation Laws of the
State of Delaware on February&nbsp;18, 2005. On June&nbsp;22, 2005,
we completedour initial public offering and commenced operations.
We operate as an externally managed, <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">closed-end,</font> <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-diversified</font> management investment
company and have elected tobe treated as a BDC under the 1940 Act.
For federal income tax purposes, we have elected to be treated as a
RIC under Subchapter M of the Code. In order to continue to qualify
as a RIC for federal income tax purposes and obtain favorable RIC
taxtreatment, we must meet certain requirements, including certain
minimum distribution requirements.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
We were established for the purpose of investing indebt and equity
securities of established private businesses operating in the U.S.
Our investment objectives are to: (i)&nbsp;achieve and grow current
income by investing in debt securities of established businesses
that we believe will providestable earnings and cash flow to pay
expenses, make principal and interest payments on our outstanding
indebtedness and make distributions to stockholders that grow over
time; and (ii)&nbsp;provide our stockholders with long-term
capitalappreciation in the value of our assets by investing in
equity securities, generally, in combination with the
aforementioned debt securities, of established businesses that we
believe can grow over time to permit us to sell our equity
investmentsfor capital gains. To achieve our objectives, our
investment strategy is to invest in several categories of debt and
equity securities, with individual investments generally totaling
up to $30&nbsp;million, although investment size may vary,depending
upon our total assets or available capital at the time of
investment. We intend that our investment portfolio over time will
consist of approximately 75% in debt securities and 25% in equity
securities, at cost. As of March&nbsp;31, 2018,our investment
portfolio was made up of 73.8% in debt securities and 26.2% in
equity securities, at cost.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
We focus on investing in Lower Middle Marketprivate businesses in
the U.S. that meet certain criteria, including, but not limited to,
the following: the sustainability of the business’ free cash flow
and its ability to grow it over time, adequate assets for loan
collateral, experiencedmanagement teams with a significant
ownership interest in the portfolio company, reasonable
capitalization of the portfolio company, including an ample equity
contribution or cushion based on prevailing enterprise valuation
multiples, and thepotential to realize appreciation and gain
liquidity in our equity position, if any. We anticipate that
liquidity in our equity position will be achieved through a merger
or acquisition of the portfolio company, a public offering of the
portfoliocompany’s stock or, to a lesser extent, by exercising our
right to require the portfolio company to repurchase our warrants,
as applicable, though there can be no assurance that we will always
have these rights. We invest in portfolio companiesthat need funds
for growth capital or to finance acquisitions or recapitalize or,
to a lesser extent, refinance their existing debt facilities. We
seek to avoid investing in high-risk, early-stage enterprises.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
We invest by ourselves or jointly with other funds and/or
management of the portfolio company, depending on the opportunity,
and have opportunistically madeseveral <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">co-investments</font> with our affiliate
Gladstone Capital pursuant to the <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">Co-Investment</font> Order. We believe the
<font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Co-Investment</font>Order has
enhanced and will continue to enhance our ability to further our
investment objectives and strategies. If we are participating in an
investment with one or more <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">co-investors,</font> whether or not
anaffiliate of ours, our investment is likely to be smaller than if
we were investing alone.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><u>Business</u></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><i>Portfolio Activity</i></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
While the business environmentremains competitive, we continue to
see new investment opportunities consistent with our investment
strategy of providing a combination of debt and equity in support
of management and independent <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">sponsor-led</font>buyouts of Lower Middle
Market companies in the U.S. For the fiscal year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018, we exited two portfolio companies with fair
values prior to their sales of $19.2&nbsp;million and
$3.4&nbsp;million, respectively, invested$59.4&nbsp;million in two
new portfolio companies, and completed two separate mergers (in
each case, one of our existing portfolio companies merged with
another one of our portfolio companies), resulting in a net
reduction of two companies from ourportfolio, which was comprised
of 33 companies as of March&nbsp;31, 2018. From our initial public
offering in June 2005 through March&nbsp;31, 2018, we have made
investments in 47 companies, excluding investments in syndicated
loans, for a total ofapproximately $1&nbsp;billion, before giving
effect to principal repayments and divestures.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">43</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The majority of the debt securities in our portfolio have a success
fee component, which enhances the yield onour debt investments.
Unlike PIK income, we generally do not recognize success fees as
income until payment has been received. Due to the contingent
nature of success fees, there are no guarantees that we will be
able to collect any or all of thesesuccess fees or know the timing
of any such collections. As a result, as of March&nbsp;31, 2018, we
had unrecognized, contractual success fees of $28.3&nbsp;million,
or $0.87 per common share. Consistent with GAAP, we generally have
not recognizedsuccess fee receivables and related income in our
<i>Consolidated Financial Statements</i> until earned.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
From inception through March&nbsp;31, 2018, wehave completed 12
buyout liquidity events, which, in the aggregate, have generated
$85.7&nbsp;million in net realized gains and $22.0&nbsp;million in
other income upon exit, for a total increase to our net assets of
$107.7&nbsp;million. We believeeach of these transactions was an
equity-oriented investment success and exemplifies our investment
strategy of striving to achieve returns through current income on
the debt portion of our investments and capital gains from the
equity portion. The12 liquidity events have offset any realized
losses since inception, which were primarily incurred during the
recession in connection with the sale of performing syndicated
loans at a realized loss to pay off a former lender. These
successful exits,in part, enabled us to increase the monthly
distribution by 62.5% from March 2011 through March&nbsp;31, 2018,
and allowed us to pay a $0.03 per common share supplemental
distribution in fiscal year 2012, a $0.05 per common share
supplementaldistribution in November 2013, a $0.05 per common share
supplemental distribution in December 2014, a $0.06 per common
share supplemental distribution in June 2017, and a $0.06 per
common share supplemental distribution in December 2017.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><i>Capital Raising Efforts</i></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
We have been able to meetour capital needs through extensions of
and increases to the Credit Facility and by accessing the capital
markets in the form of public offerings of common and preferred
stock. We have successfully extended the Credit Facility’s
revolvingperiod multiple times, most recently to November 2019, and
currently have a total commitment amount of $165.0&nbsp;million
(with a potential total commitment of $250.0&nbsp;million through
additional commitments of new or existing lenders). Duringthe year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2018, we sold 127,412 shares of our common
stock under our <font STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">at-the-market</font></font> program for gross
proceeds of approximately $1.3&nbsp;million.Additionally, we issued
approximately 2.3&nbsp;million shares of common stock for gross
proceeds of $21.2&nbsp;million in May 2017, inclusive of the June
2017 over-allotment, and 2.3&nbsp;million shares of our Series D
Term Preferred Stock for grossproceeds of $57.5&nbsp;million in
September 2016. Refer to “<i>Management’s Discussion and Analysis
of Financial Condition and Results of Operations — Overview —
Recent Developments — <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">At-the-Market</font></i> Program” for a
discussion of our <font STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">at-the-market</font></font> program, to 
“<i>Liquidity and Capital Resources— Revolving Line of Credit</i>”
for further discussion of the Credit Facility and to “<i>Liquidity
and Capital Resources — Equity — Common Stock</i>” and 
“<i>Liquidity and Capital Resources — Equity —Term Preferred
Stock</i>” for further discussion of our common stock and
mandatorily redeemable preferred stock.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Although we have been able toaccess the capital markets
historically, market conditions may continue to affect the trading
price of our common stock and thus our ability to finance new
investments through the issuance of common equity. On May&nbsp;14,
2018, the closing marketprice of our common stock was $11.25 per
share, which represented a 3.7% premium to our March&nbsp;31, 2018
NAV per share of $10.85. When our common stock trades below NAV,
our ability to issue additional equity is constrained by provisions
of the1940 Act, which generally prohibits the issuance and sale of
our common stock at an issuance price below the then current NAV
per share without stockholder approval, other than through sales to
our then existing stockholders pursuant to a rightsoffering.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
At our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders held on August&nbsp;24,
2017, our stockholders approved a proposal authorizing us to issue
and sellshares of our common stock at a price below our then
current NAV per share, subject to certain limitations, including
that the number of common shares issued and sold pursuant to such
authority does not exceed 25.0% of our then outstanding commonstock
immediately prior to each such sale, provided that our Board of
Directors makes certain determinations prior to any such sale. This
August 2017 stockholder authorization is in effect for one year
from the date of stockholder approval. Wesought and obtained
stockholder approval concerning similar proposals at each Annual
Meeting of Stockholders since 2008, and with our Board of Directors’
 subsequent approval, we issued shares of our common stock in three
offerings at a pricebelow the then current NAV per share, once in
May 2017, once in March 2015, and once in October 2012. Certain
sales under the <font STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">at-the-market</font></font> program in March
2018 werealso below the then current estimated NAV per share. The
resulting proceeds, in part, have allowed us to (i)&nbsp;grow our
portfolio by making new investments, (ii)&nbsp;generate additional
income through these new investments, (iii)&nbsp;ensurecontinued
compliance with regulatory tests and (iv)&nbsp;increase our debt
capital while still complying with our applicable <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap"><font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">debt-to-equity</font></font> ratios. Refer
to<i>“Liquidity and Capital Resources — Equity — Common Stock”</i>
for further discussion of our common stock.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">44</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><i>Regulatory Compliance</i></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Our ability to seek external debt financing, to the extent that it
is available under current market conditions, is further subject to
the asset coveragelimitations of the 1940 Act, which require us to
have an asset coverage ratio (as defined in Sections 18 and 61 of
the 1940 Act), of at least 200.0% (currently) or 150.0% (effective
April&nbsp;10, 2019; refer to “<i>Management’s Discussionand
Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations —
Overview — Recent Developments — Small Business Credit Availability
Act</i>” for a discussion of changes to the asset coverage
requirements pursuant to the SBCAA) oneach of our senior securities
representing indebtedness and our senior securities that are stock
(such as our three series of term preferred stock). As of
March&nbsp;31, 2018, our asset coverage ratio on our senior
securities representingindebtedness was 525.7% and our asset
coverage ratio on our senior securities that are stock was
237.3%.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><u>Investment Highlights</u></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
For the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018, and inclusive of
<font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</font> transactions, we
invested $59.4&nbsp;millionin two new portfolio companies, received
$83.2&nbsp;million in proceeds from repayments and sales, and
extended $82.1&nbsp;million of <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">follow-on</font> investments to existing
portfolio companies through revolverdraws, term loans, and
additions to equity, as applicable.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">

significant transactions occurred:</p>

<table STYLE=

BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<td WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</td>
<td WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">•</td>
<td WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">In June 2017, one of our portfolio
companies, Mathey Investments, Inc. (“Mathey”) merged with and into
another one of our portfolio companies, SBS Industries, LLC (“SBS”
). As a result of thistransaction, we received success fee income
of $0.3&nbsp;million from Mathey. Our debt investments in Mathey,
which totaled $8.6&nbsp;million at principal and cost, were assumed
by SBS and combined with our existing debt investment in SBS,
whichtotaled $11.4&nbsp;million at principal and cost, into a new
secured first lien term loan totaling $20.0&nbsp;million. Our
common equity investment in Mathey, with a cost basis of
$0.8&nbsp;million, was converted into a preferred equity
investmentin SBS with the same cost basis. In connection with the
merger, we also extended a secured first lien revolving line of
credit to SBS with a total facility amount of $1.5&nbsp;million,
which was undrawn at the time of the transaction.</td>
</tr>
</table>

Molded”). As a result of this transaction, our debt investments in
GI Plastek and Precision, which totaled $15.0&nbsp;million and

assumed by PSIMolded and combined into a new secured second lien
term loan totaling $24.6&nbsp;million. Our preferred equity
investment in GI Plastek, with a cost basis of $5.2&nbsp;million
and our preferred and common equity investments in Precision, with
acombined cost basis of $3.8&nbsp;million, were converted into a
preferred equity investment in PSI Molded with the same cost
basis.</td>

<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><u>Recent Developments</u></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><i><font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">At-the-Market</font></i>
Program</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
In February 2018, we entered into equitydistribution agreements
(commonly referred to as <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap"><font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">
“at-the-market”</font></font> (“ATM”) programs) with Cantor
Fitzgerald&nbsp;&amp; Co. (“Cantor”),Ladenburg Thalmann&nbsp;&amp;
Co., Inc., and Wedbush Securities, Inc. (each a “Sales Agent”),
under which we have the ability to issue and sell shares of our
common stock, from time to time, through the Sales Agents, up to an
aggregateoffering price of $35.0&nbsp;million. During the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2018, we sold 127,412 shares of our common
stock under the ATM program with Cantor at a weighted-average gross
price of $10.45 per share and raised approximately$1.3&nbsp;million
of gross proceeds.&nbsp;The weighted-average net price per share,
after deducting commissions and offering costs borne by us, was
$10.24 and resulted in total net proceeds of approximately
$1.3&nbsp;million. These sales were belowour then current estimated
NAV per share during the sales period, with such discounts ranging
from $0.01 per share to $0.07 per share, when comparing the sales
price per share, after deducting commissions, to the then current
estimated NAV pershare; however, the net dilutive effect (after
commissions and offering costs borne by us) of these sales was
$0.00 per common share. As of March&nbsp;31, 2018, we had a
remaining capacity to sell up to $33.7&nbsp;million of common stock
under theATM program.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Subsequent to March&nbsp;31, 2018 and through May&nbsp;8, 2018, we
sold an additional 168,824 shares of our common stock under our
ATMprogram with Cantor at a weighted-average gross price of $11.09
per share and raised approximately $1.9&nbsp;million of gross
proceeds.&nbsp;The weighted-average net price per share, after
deducting commissions and offering costs borne by us, was$10.87 and
resulted in total net proceeds of approximately $1.8&nbsp;million.
Certain of these sales were below our then current estimated NAV
per share during the sales period, with a discount of $0.002 per
share, when comparing the sales price pershare, after deducting
commissions, to the then current estimated NAV per share; however,
the net dilutive effect (after commissions and offering costs borne
by us) of these sales was $0.00 per common share. In aggregate,
these sales were above ourthen current estimated NAV per share.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><i>Small Business Credit Availability Act</i></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
On April&nbsp;10, 2018, our Board of Directors, including a 
“required majority” (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;57(o)
of the 1940 Act)thereof, approved the modified asset coverage
requirements set forth in Section&nbsp;61(a)(2) of the 1940 Act, as
amended by the SBCAA. As a result, the Company’s asset coverage
requirements for senior securities will be changed from 200%
to150%, effective one year after the date of the Board of Directors’
 approval; or April&nbsp;10, 2019. Notwithstanding the modified
asset coverage requirement under the 1940 Act described above, we
are separately subject to a minimum assetcoverage requirement of
200% with respect to certain provisions of our Credit Facility and
our three series of mandatorily redeemable preferred stock.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><i>Registration Statement</i></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
On June&nbsp;16, 2015, wefiled a registration statement on Form
<font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">N-2</font> (File <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">No.&nbsp;333-204996)</font> with the SEC and
subsequently filed a <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">Pre-Effective</font>Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to
the registration statement on July&nbsp;28, 2015, which the SEC
declared effective on July&nbsp;29, 2015. On June&nbsp;8, 2016, we
filed Post-Effective Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to the registration
statement, which the SECdeclared effective on July&nbsp;28, 2016.
On July&nbsp;28, 2017, we filed Post-Effective Amendment No.&nbsp;5
to the registration statement, which the SEC declared effective on
July&nbsp;31, 2017. The registration statement permits us to
issue,through one or more transactions, up to an aggregate of
$300.0&nbsp;million in</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">46</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
securities, consisting of common stock, preferred stock,
subscription rights, debt securities and warrants to purchase
common stock, preferred stock or debt securities, including
throughconcurrent, separate offerings of such securities. As of
March&nbsp;31, 2018, we had the ability to issue up to
$220.0&nbsp;million in securities under the registration
statement.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><i>Common stock offering</i></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
In May 2017, we completed apublic offering of 2.1&nbsp;million
shares of our common stock at a public offering price of $9.38 per
share, which was below our then current NAV of $9.95 per share.
Gross proceeds totaled $19.7&nbsp;million and net proceeds, after
deductingunderwriting discounts and commissions and offering costs
borne by us, were $18.7&nbsp;million, which were used to repay
borrowings under the Credit Facility and other general corporate
purposes. In June 2017, the underwriters partially exercisedtheir
over-allotment option and purchased an additional 155,265 shares at
the public offering price of $9.38 per share and on the same terms
and conditions solely to cover over-allotments, which resulted in
gross proceeds of $1.5&nbsp;million andnet proceeds, after
deducting underwriting discounts and commissions and offering costs
borne by us, of $1.4&nbsp;million.</p>

<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<i>NM = Not Meaningful</i></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Investment Income</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Total investment income increased by12.5% for the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018 as compared to the prior year. This increase
was due to increases in both interest income and other income for
the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018 as compared to the prior
year.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Interest income from our investments in debt securities increased
5.7% for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018 as compared to the
prior year. The level ofinterest income from investments is
directly related to the principal balance of our interest-bearing
investment portfolio outstanding during the period multiplied by
the weighted average yield. The weighted average principal balance
of ourinterest-bearing investment portfolio during the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018, was $373.4&nbsp;million, compared to
$364.7&nbsp;million for the prior year. This increase was primarily
due to $47.2&nbsp;million in new debt investments
and$68.8&nbsp;million in <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">follow-on</font> debt investments to existing
portfolio companies originated after March&nbsp;31, 2017, partially
offset by the <font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pay-off</font> or
restructure of$65.3&nbsp;million of debt investments principally
related to the exit, merger, or restructure of portfolio companies,
and their respective impact on the weighted average principal
balance when considering the timing of new investments, pay-offs,
mergers, restructures, and <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-accruals,</font> as applicable. The
weighted average yield on our interest-bearing investments,
excluding cash and cash equivalents andreceipts recorded as other
income, was 13.1% and 12.7% for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018
and 2017, respectively. The weighted average yield may vary from
period to period, based on the current stated interest rate on
interest-bearinginvestments.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">48</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
At March&nbsp;31, 2018, and March&nbsp;31, 2017, certain of our
loans to two portfolio companies, Alloy DieCasting Co. (“ADC”) and
Tread Corporation (“Tread”), were on <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-accrual</font> status, with an aggregate
debt cost basis of $15.6&nbsp;million as of both periods.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Other income for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018 increased 66.8%
from the prior year. During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018,
other income primarilyconsisted of $4.2&nbsp;million of dividend
income and $5.3&nbsp;million of success fee income. During the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2017, other income primarily consisted of
$3.3&nbsp;million of dividend income and $2.4&nbsp;million of
success feeincome.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The following table lists the investment income for our five
largest portfolio company investments, at fair value, during the
respective fiscalyears:</p>

<td VALIGN="bottom"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>
<td VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><b>100.0</b></td>
<td NOWRAP="nowrap" VALIGN="bottom"><b>%&nbsp;</b></td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom"><b>$</b></td>
<td VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><b>51,872</b></td>
<td NOWRAP="nowrap" VALIGN="bottom"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>

<p STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(A)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">New investment during the applicable
year.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Expenses</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Total expenses, net of any <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-contractual,</font> unconditional, and
irrevocable credits from the Adviser, increased23.6% for the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2018, as compared to the prior year, primarily
due to an increase in the incentive fee, the base management fee,
and interest and dividend expense, partially offset by a decrease
in amortization of deferredfinancing fees and discounts.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The income-based incentive fee increased for the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018, as compared to the prior year, as
pre-incentive fee net investment income increased, partially offset
by an increase in net assets, which drives the hurdle rate.
Additionally, in accordance with GAAP, we recorded a capital
gains-based incentive feeof $4.4&nbsp;million during the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018, which is not contractually due under the terms
of the Advisory Agreement. There was no capital gains-based
incentive fee recorded or paid during the prior year.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The base management fee increased for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2018, as compared to the prior year, as average total assets
increased over the period.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">49</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The base management fee, loan servicing fee, incentive fee, and
their related<font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-contractual,</font> unconditional, and
irrevocable credits are computed quarterly, as described under 
“<i>Transactions with the Adviser</i>” in Note 4 – <i>Related Party
Transactions</i> in theaccompanying <i>Notes to Consolidated
Financial Statements</i> and are summarized in the following
table:</p>
<p STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">

<td VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom"><b>$</b></td>
<td VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><b>10,648</b></td>
<td NOWRAP="nowrap" VALIGN="bottom"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">$</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">4,750</td>
<td NOWRAP="nowrap" VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
<tr STYLE="font-size:1px;">
<td VALIGN="bottom"></td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">
&nbsp;</p>
</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">
&nbsp;</p>
</td>
<td>&nbsp;</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">
&nbsp;</p>
</td>
<td VALIGN="bottom">
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:3.00px double #000000">
&nbsp;</p>
</td>
<td>&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(A)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Average total assets subject to the
base management fee is defined in the Advisory Agreement as total
assets, including investments made with proceeds of borrowings,less
any uninvested cash or cash equivalents resulting from borrowings,
valued at the end of the applicable quarters within the respective
periods and adjusted appropriately for any share issuances or
repurchases during the periods.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(B)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Reflected as a line item on our
accompanying <i>Consolidated Statement of Operations</i>.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(C)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">The capital gains-based incentive fee
is not contractually due under the terms of the Advisory
Agreement.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Interest and dividend expense increased 6.7% during the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018, as compared to the prior year, primarily due
to higher costs ofborrowings under the Credit Facility. The
effective interest rate on the Credit Facility, excluding the
impact of deferred financing costs, during the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018 was 5.4%, as compared to 4.7% in the prior
year. Dividends on ourmandatorily redeemable preferred stock
increased $0.3&nbsp;million in the current year, when the Series D
Term Preferred Stock was outstanding for the entire year, as
compared to the prior year, when the Series D Term Preferred Stock
was newlyissued and only outstanding for a portion of the period
and the 7.125% Series A Cumulative Term Preferred Stock (our 
“Series A Term Preferred Stock” or “Series A”) was outstanding
until September 2016.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Amortization of deferred financing costs and discounts decreased
21.7% for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018 as compared to the
prior year, primarily as aresult of the <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">write-off</font> of previously deferred costs
in the prior year related to the Credit Facility’s amendment in
November 2016.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Realized and Unrealized Gain (Loss)</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<i>Net Realized Gainon Investments</i></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018, we recorded a net
realized gain on investments of $1.3&nbsp;million, primarily
related to a$1.0&nbsp;million realized gain from the exit of
Mitchell, compared to net realized gains on investments of
$15.6&nbsp;million during the prior year period, primarily related
to an $18.9&nbsp;million realized gain from the exit of Acme
Cryogenics,Inc. (“Acme”), a $5.9&nbsp;million realized gain from
the exit of Behrens Manufacturing, LLC (“Behrens”), and a
$1.3&nbsp;million realized gain related to an additional
<font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">earn-out</font> from Funko,LLC,
which was exited during the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016,
partially offset by a $10.2&nbsp;million realized loss from the
restructure of D.P.M.S., Inc. (“Danco”).</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<i>Net Realized Loss on Other</i></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
There were no realized gainsor losses on other during the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2018. During the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2017, we recorded a net realized loss on other of
$0.3&nbsp;million, of which $0.2&nbsp;million related to the
redemption of our Series ATermPreferred Stock in September 2016 and
$0.1&nbsp;million related to the expiration of our interest rate
cap agreement in April 2016.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">50</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />

unrealized appreciation of investments of $37.9&nbsp;million. The
realized gains (losses) andunrealized appreciation (depreciation)
across our investments for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018, were
as follows:</p>

</table>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The primary drivers of net unrealized appreciation of investments
of $37.9&nbsp;million for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2018were
increased performance of certain of our portfolio companies and an
increase in comparable multiples used to estimate the fair value of
certain of our portfolio companies, partially offset by the
reversal of previously recorded unrealizedappreciation upon the
exit of our investment in Mitchell and a decline in performance of
certain of our other portfolio companies.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">51</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017, we recorded net
unrealized appreciation of investments of$6.9&nbsp;million. The
realized gains (losses) and unrealized appreciation (depreciation)
across our investments for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017 were
as follows:</p>

</table>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:14pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The primary drivers of net unrealized appreciation of investments
of $6.9&nbsp;million for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017were the
reversal of previously recorded unrealized depreciation related to
our investment in Danco upon its restructure, an increase in the
fair value of our investment in Mitchell based on its sale in April
2017, and increased performance andcomparable multiples used to
estimate the fair value of certain of our investments, which was
partially offset by unrealized depreciation resulting from the
reversal of previously recorded unrealized appreciation related to
the exit of ourinvestments in Acme and Behrens and a decrease in
performance of certain of our portfolio companies.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:14pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Across our entire investment portfolio, we
recorded$13.9&nbsp;million of net unrealized depreciation on our
debt positions and $51.8&nbsp;million of net unrealized
appreciation on our equity holdings for the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018. At March&nbsp;31, 2018, the fair value of our
investmentportfolio was greater than our cost basis by
$14.3&nbsp;million, as compared to March&nbsp;31, 2017, when the
fair value of our investment portfolio was less than our cost basis
by $23.6&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2017, representing
netunrealized appreciation of $37.9&nbsp;million for the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018. Our entire portfolio was fair valued at 102.4%
of cost as of March&nbsp;31, 2018.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<i>Net Unrealized Appreciation on Other</i></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
During the yearended March&nbsp;31, 2018, we recorded net
unrealized appreciation of other of $0.5&nbsp;million related to
the Credit Facility recorded at fair value. During the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2017, we recorded net unrealized appreciation on
other of$0.1&nbsp;million due to the reversal of previously
recorded depreciation upon the expiration of our interest rate cap
agreement in April 2016.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">52</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>

<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<i>NM = Not Meaningful</i></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Investment Income</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Total investment income increased by1.8% for the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2017, as compared to the prior year. This increase
was due to an increase in other income, partially offset by a
slight decline in interest income for the same period, which
resulted primarily from a smalldecrease in the size of our
interest-bearing portfolio during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2017.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Interest income from our investments in debt securitiesremained
relatively flat for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017, as compared
to the prior year. The level of interest income from investments is
directly related to the principal balance of our interest-bearing
investment portfolio outstandingduring the period multiplied by the
weighted average yield. The weighted average principal balance of
our interest-bearing investment portfolio during the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2017, was $364.7&nbsp;million, compared to
$367.6&nbsp;million forthe prior year. This slight decrease was
primarily due to the <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">pay-off</font> or restructure of
$48.4&nbsp;million of debt investments principally related to the
exit or restructure of portfolio companies, and
to$41.6&nbsp;million in new debt investments and $15.5&nbsp;million
in <font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">follow-on</font> debt
investments to existing portfolio companies originated after
March&nbsp;31, 2016, and their respective impact on the
weightedaverage principal balance when considering timing of new
investments, <font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pay-offs,</font>
restructures, and <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-accruals,</font> as applicable. The
weighted average yield on ourinterest-bearing investments,
excluding cash and cash equivalents and receipts recorded as other
income, was 12.7% and 12.6% for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017
and 2016, respectively. The weighted average yield may vary from
period to period,based on the current stated interest rate on
interest-bearing investments.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">53</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
At March&nbsp;31, 2017, certain of our loans to two portfolio
companies, ADC and Tread, were on non-accrual status, with an
aggregate debt cost basis of $15.6&nbsp;million. At March&nbsp;31,
2016, our loan to Tread was on <font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-accrual</font> status, with an aggregate
debt costbasis of $1.4&nbsp;million.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Other income for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017 increased 25.7%
from the prior year. During the year ended March&nbsp;31,2017,
other income primarily consisted of $3.3&nbsp;million of dividend
income and $2.4&nbsp;million of success fee income. During the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, other income primarily consisted of
$2.9&nbsp;million of dividend income and$1.6&nbsp;million of
success fee income.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The following table lists the investment income for our five
largest portfolio company investments, at fairvalue, during the
respective fiscal years:</p>

<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Expenses</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Total expenses, net of any non-contractual, unconditional, and
irrevocable credits from the Adviser, decreased 2.6% for the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2017, as compared to the prior year, primarily
due to a decrease in the incentive fee. Theincentive fee decreased
as a result of an increase in net assets, which drives the hurdle
rate, period over period.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">54</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The base management fee, loan servicing fee, incentive fee, and
their related<font STYLE=
"white-space:nowrap">non-contractual,</font> unconditional, and
irrevocable credits are computed quarterly, as described under 
“<i>Transactions with the Adviser</i>” in Note 4 – <i>Related Party
Transactions</i> in thenotes to our accompanying <i>Consolidated
Financial Statements</i> and are summarized in the following
table:</p>
<p STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
&nbsp;</p>

<td>&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(A)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Average total assets subject to the
base management fee is defined in the Advisory Agreement as total
assets, including investments made with proceeds of borrowings,less
any uninvested cash or cash equivalents resulting from borrowings,
valued at the end of the applicable quarters within the respective
periods and adjusted appropriately for any share issuances or
repurchases during the periods.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table STYLE=
"BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"
BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<tr STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><sup STYLE=
"font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(B)</sup></td>
<td ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Reflected as a line item on our
accompanying <i>Consolidated Statement of Operations</i>.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>Realized and Unrealized Gain (Loss)</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<i>Net Realized Gain(Loss) on Investments</i></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017, we recorded a net
realized gain on investments of $15.6&nbsp;million,
primarilyrelated to a $18.9&nbsp;million realized gain from the
exit of Acme, a $5.9&nbsp;million realized gain from the exit of
Behrens, and a $1.3&nbsp;million realized gain related to an
additional <font STYLE="white-space:nowrap">earn-out</font>
fromFunko, LLC, which was exited during the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2016, partially offset by a $10.2&nbsp;million
realized loss from the restructure of Danco. During the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2016, we recorded a net realized loss
of$4.6&nbsp;million, primarily related to realized losses of
$10.5&nbsp;million, $2.8&nbsp;million, and $8.6&nbsp;million
related to the restructuring of our investments in Galaxy Tool
Holding Corporation (“Galaxy”), NDLI, Inc.(“NDLI”), and Tread,
respectively, partially offset by a realized gain of
$17.0&nbsp;million related to the sale of our investments in Funko,
LLC and $0.3&nbsp;million of other gains.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<i>Net Realized Loss on Other</i></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
During the year endedMarch&nbsp;31, 2017, we recorded a net
realized loss on other of $0.3&nbsp;million, of which
$0.2&nbsp;million related to the redemption of our Series A Term
Preferred Stock in September 2016 and $0.1&nbsp;million related to
the expiration of ourinterest rate cap agreement in April 2016.
There were no realized gains or losses on other during the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2016.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">55</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />

<i>Net Unrealized Appreciation of Investments</i></p>

"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017, we recorded net
unrealized appreciation of investments of $6.9&nbsp;million. The
realized gains (losses) andunrealized appreciation (depreciation)
across our investments for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017, were
as follows:</p>

</table>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The primary drivers of net unrealized appreciation of investments
of $6.9&nbsp;million for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017were the
reversal of previously recorded unrealized depreciation related to
our investment in Danco upon its restructure, an increase in the
fair value of our investment in Mitchell based on its sale in April
2017, and increased performance andcomparable multiples used to
estimate the fair value of certain of our investments, which was
partially offset by unrealized depreciation resulting from the
reversal of previously recorded unrealized appreciation related to
the exit of ourinvestments in Acme and Behrens and a decrease in
performance of certain of our portfolio companies.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">56</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, we recorded net
unrealized appreciation of investments of$8.7&nbsp;million. The
realized gains (losses) and unrealized appreciation (depreciation)
across our investments for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 were
as follows:</p>

<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
The primary drivers of net unrealized appreciation of investments
of $8.7&nbsp;million for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016were an
increase in the equity valuation of Acme due to an increase in
performance and comparable multiples used to estimate the fair
value of our investment, as well as an increase in performance and,
to a lesser extent, multiples used to estimatethe fair value of
certain of our other investments and the reversal of previously
recorded unrealized depreciation on our investments in Galaxy,
NDLI, and Tread upon their restructures. These increases were
partially offset by the reversal ofpreviously recorded unrealized
appreciation on our investments in Cavert II Holding Corp. and
Funko, LLC upon their exits as well as a decline in the performance
of certain portfolio companies.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Across our entire investment portfolio, we recorded
$10.0&nbsp;million of net unrealized appreciation on our debt
positions and $3.1&nbsp;million of netunrealized depreciation on
our equity holdings for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017. At
March&nbsp;31, 2017, the fair value of our investment portfolio was
less than our cost basis by $23.6&nbsp;million, as compared to
$30.5&nbsp;million atMarch&nbsp;31, 2016, representing net
unrealized appreciation of $6.9&nbsp;million for the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2017. Our entire portfolio was fair valued at 95.5%
of cost as of March&nbsp;31, 2017.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">57</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<i>Net Unrealized Appreciation on Other</i></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
For the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017, we recorded net unrealized
appreciation on other of $0.1&nbsp;million due to the reversal of
previously recordeddepreciation upon the expiration of our interest
rate cap agreement in April 2016. For the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2016, no such amounts were incurred.</p>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">
&nbsp;</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"
ALIGN="center">58</p>
<p STYLE='page-break-before:always'></p>
<hr SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="center" />
<h5 ALIGN="left"><a HREF="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b>LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES</b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
<b><u>Operating Activities</u></b></p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Cash inflows from operatingactivities are primarily generated from
cash collections of interest and other income from our portfolio
companies, as well as from cash proceeds received from repayments
of debt investments and from sales of equity investments. These
cashcollections are principally used to fund new investments, pay
distributions to our common stockholders, make interest payments on
the Credit Facility, make dividend payments on our mandatorily
redeemable preferred stock, pay management and incentivefees to the
Adviser, and for other operating expenses. We may also use cash
collections from operations to repay outstanding borrowings under
the Credit Facility.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Net cash used in operating activities for the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018 was $28.8&nbsp;million, as compared to net cash
provided by operating activitiesof $32.5&nbsp;million for the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2017. This change was primarily due to an
increase in purchases of investments and lower repayments and net
proceeds from the sale of investments. Purchases of investments
totaled$98.5&nbsp;million during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2018, compared to $62.4&nbsp;million during the year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2017. Repayments and net proceeds from the sale of
investments totaled $39.9&nbsp;million during the year
endedMarch&nbsp;31, 2018 compared to $68.8&nbsp;million during the
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Net cash provided by operating activities for the yearended
March&nbsp;31, 2017 was $32.5&nbsp;million, as compared to
$4.1&nbsp;million for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. This
change was primarily due to an increase in repayments and net
proceeds from the sale of investments year over year.Repayments and
net proceeds from the sale of investments totaled
$68.8&nbsp;million during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2017
compared to $44.6&nbsp;million during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2016.</p>
<p STYLE=
"margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
As of March&nbsp;31, 2018, we had equity investments in, or loans
to, 33 companies with an aggregate cost basis of
$584.8&nbsp;million. As of March&nbsp;31,2017, we had equity
investments in, or loans to, 35 companies with an aggregate cost
basis of $525.2&nbsp;million. The following table summarizes our
total portfolio investment activity for the years ended
March&nbsp;31, 2018 and 2017:</p>
<p STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
